As one of the leading

# NYC Corporate and Medical Photographer

Robert Essel works in Manhattan photographing for leading hospitals and
corporations.  
  

## Corporate Portrait Photographers

| Robert Essel is a professional corporate photographer who specializes in
photographing executive portraits, professional headshots, corporate meetings,
group shots at any business location. Robert photographs for editorial,
advertising and business clients for various Fortune 500 corporations. His
photos have appeared in various business publications, brochures, annual
reports, websites and advertising campaigns. His imagery is a blend of
carefully crafted photo lighting techniques supported by latest up to date
cutting edge photographic equipment. He understands his subjects sometimes
have a limited amount time in a photography session but works under tight
deadlines to deliver quality finished digital images.  
  

## 3: NYC Portrait Photographers

| Robert is a portrait photographer located in New York City. He has been a
resident of The Big Apple for about 30 plus years and loves photographing the
people and multiracial community. One block away from his location is Central
Park, his backyard. The park has a lot of great photo locations like
Strawberry Fields, Bethesda Fountain, Sheep Meadow, Bow Bridge, The Lake, The
Boathouse, etc. These iconic photographic locations make great backgrounds for
environmental portraits, business portraits, personal portraits, group
portraits and family portraits. The special iconic locations here in NY add
another dimension of realism and value to the photos.  
  

Healthcare Photographer | Robert has documented in many medical institutions.
His camera lens has recorded many doctors, nurses, patients, researchers,
technicians and support staff in a variety of hospitals, clinics, operating
rooms and labs. Robert has donated his time to local and overseas charitable
hospital programs in his recent travels to Africa. Mission in Tanzania is a
program associated with Weill Cornell in which Robert gave of his time to
helping the people of that African nation.. Capturing unique imagery has
always been the number one goal to pleasing clients. He is great collaborator
and enjoys the team spirit of listening and helping people solve creative
photographic problems and to turn them into creative solutions.  
  

## People Photographer NYC

| Successful corporate portrait photography sometimes requires pre-planning in
order to get great digital image captures. How a business professional dresses
is very important for a portrait sitting. Business attire that is tailored
says a lot about the person. The color of a guy’s tie or the color of a
woman’s dress, say something from a psychological point of view. By wearing
red you are implying that you mean business. Blue conveys trust, stability and
confidence. Green is about practicality, reliability and implies being down to
Earth. Business headshot photography is valuable asset for any professional to
be noticed and respected.  
  

6: Corporate People Photographer | When doing a photo shoot for clients they
ask what should I wear for my professional portrait session. I recommend
comfortable fitting clothes that are solid in color, pastel and or simple in
design. The idea is to dress for success but not have the fashion of your
clothes overpower your face. As one of the NYC corporate portrait
photographers here in New York business people time is valuable, so being
efficient in the preparation is a must.. Corporate people photographers need
to help business professionals and entrepreneurs elevate their stature
pictorially through the universal language of photography. The photo assistant
is always on hand to help style an executive portrait, apply makeup when
needed and keep a watchful eye on any hair that may become out of place. Our
goal is to promote a supportive environment so subjects feel relaxed and they
know they are well looked after.  
  

## New York Executive Portrait Headshot Photographers

| As a corporate people photographer, business clients often ask how many
photos do you take during a corporate photography session. There is no limit
on how many photos will be taken for photo shoot for corporate headshots, just
the amount of images that are required. Some people warm to the camera quickly
and other business professionals need more time to relax and so we are happy
accommodate them during their corporate portraits. As a NYC corporate portrait
photographer we love helping people achieve their greatness by empowering them
in conversation and capturing great images. As a professional photographer we
have photographed business professionals in the photographic studio. We also
set up lighting and sometimes backgrounds on location in businessman’s office,
conference room or just utilizing the office environment. Our forte is
photographing execs on location for industry, in boardrooms and other places
of business. The staff bring in our own camera gear when taking photos and on
occasion we will shoot with available light, depending on the lighting
conditions at a location and or if there is a time limit to complete the
photography.  
  

## Corporate Industrial Photographer NYC

| As an industrial photographer we have traveled internationally for a diverse
list of blue chip corporations. Photographing industrial sites are like the
bright lights of self-contained little cities with an endless array of pipes,
wires and metal structures. The key in my opinion to capturing dynamic images
in this industrial manufacturing environment is to focus on the simplicity of
design and shapes. Industry that focuses on assembly line production,
carefully crafted products or are service based companies each require their
own special creative solutions from a visual standpoint. The use of
photographic lighting can help further enhance and define industry elements
and help strengthen the photographic message.  
  

Robert Essel serves New Jersey, Manhattan, New York City, Newark.
